function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Increased health harming behaviors during lockdown, including smoking, alcohol consumption, and poor diet.","Impact":"Higher risk of non-communicable diseases (NCDs) such as coronary heart disease, stroke, hypertension, type 2 diabetes, and some forms of cancer.","Mitigation":"Promotion of healthy behaviors through education, support services, and access to nutritious food options.","Technologies":"Telemedicine for remote health support, mobile apps for tracking and promoting physical activity and diet.","People":"Adults in lockdown, particularly those experiencing negative changes in physical activity, alcohol consumption, and smoking.","Owner":"Health authorities, community organizations, and support groups."},{"Description":"Declining levels of physical activity and reductions in fruit and vegetable intake during lockdown.","Impact":"Increased risk of obesity, eating disorders, and other non-communicable diseases.","Mitigation":"Promotion of physical activity at home, access to affordable and nutritious food options, and mental health support.","Technologies":"Online fitness and workout programs, telemedicine for mental health support, mobile apps for nutrition tracking and meal planning.","People":"Individuals experiencing declines in physical activity and changes in dietary habits during lockdown.","Owner":"Health and wellness organizations, fitness professionals, and mental health practitioners."},{"Description":"Increased binge drinking during lockdown.","Impact":"Higher risk of alcohol-related health issues, including liver disease and mental health challenges.","Mitigation":"Access to mental health support, promotion of responsible drinking habits, and restrictions on alcohol availability.","Technologies":"Telemedicine for alcohol counseling, mobile apps for tracking and moderating alcohol consumption, digital support communities for individuals struggling with alcohol use.","People":"Individuals experiencing negative changes in drinking habits during lockdown.","Owner":"Mental health professionals, addiction support services, and policy makers."}]}
